intro: Gothofreda mucronata, commonly known as the sharp-tipped orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in the undergrowth of dense rainforests. Its root system is adapted to absorb nutrients from the rich, organic soil of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
